author: Staff Reporter
text:
Participants in an education fair at ITC Grand Chola on Sunday —Photo: B. Jothi Ramalingam

A large number of city students took part in a ‘study abroad’ education fair organised by IDP Education on Sunday and explored courses offered by universities and institutions in the U.S., New Zealand, Canada and United Kingdom (U.K.).

Ashish Arora, Director, Sales and Operations, IDP India, said there had been a sustained interest among Chennai students in pursuing higher education abroad over the years.

“While they used to be interested in going to U.K. and Australia, apart from the U.S., we are seeing an increase in interest for universities in Canada this year. The country has been very welcoming to Indian students and the quality of education and the jobs offered have been a draw,” he said.

Representatives from over 80 universities and institutions from the U.S., U.K., New Zealand and Canada interacted with the students.

Engineering preferred

“There still remains a preference for engineering and IT, followed by courses in business,” said Radhika Somasundaram, Head of Sales, IDP Chennai and Kerala.

Apart from Chennai, the fair will also be held in Kolkata, Ludhiana, Chandigarh, Gurgaon, New Delhi and Coimbatore.

Mr. Arora said that there was a marked increase in the number of students opting for courses related to biomedical, healthcare and hospital management.

“With the healthcare industry growing in the country, even medical students are opting for such postgraduate courses abroad to come back to India and work in corporate hospitals,” he said.
title: Canada draws more Indian students
